verses.text: The LORD said to Moses, "Speak to the priests, the sons of Aaron, and say to them: None shall make himself ceremonially unclean for a dead person among his people,
verses.comment: ‘Unclean’ translates the Hebrew ‘tame,’ meaning ritually defiled by contact with a corpse.

verses.text: except for his closest relatives: his mother, his father, his son, his daughter, or his brother,
verses.comment: Maintains the ‘except’ limitation for immediate family.

verses.text: and also for his unmarried sister, who is near to him, who has not been married; for her he may become unclean.
verses.comment: ‘Who is near to him’ clarifies ‘who is close to him’ as unmarried and living with the priest.

verses.text: But he shall not make himself unclean as a chief among his people, and so profane himself.
verses.comment: ‘Chief’ translates the Hebrew, meaning one holding an office or status.

verses.text: They shall not shave their heads or shave off the edges of their beards, or make any cuts in their flesh.
verses.comment: ‘Cuts’ refers to mourning customs of pagan nations forbidden to priests.

verses.text: They shall be holy to their God and shall not profane the name of their God. For they offer the LORD's food offerings, the bread of their God; so they must be holy.
verses.comment: ‘Bread of their God’ is a reference to sacrificial food.

verses.text: They shall not marry a woman who is a prostitute or defiled, nor shall they marry a woman divorced from her husband. For the priest is holy to his God.
verses.comment: Word choices follow original: ‘prostitute’, ‘defiled’, ‘divorced’.

verses.text: You shall set him apart as holy, for he offers the bread of your God. He shall be holy to you, for I the LORD, who makes you holy, am holy.
verses.comment: ‘Set him apart’ for ‘sanctify,’ meaning separate for holy service.

verses.text: If a priest's daughter profanes herself by becoming a prostitute, she profanes her father; she shall be burned with fire.
verses.comment: Maintains gravity of penalty as in original text.

verses.text: The priest who is highest among his brothers, upon whose head the anointing oil has been poured, and who has been ordained to wear the garments, shall not let his hair become unkempt or tear his clothes.
verses.comment: ‘Highest among his brothers’ refers to the high priest.

verses.text: He shall not go near any dead body, nor make himself unclean, even for his father or his mother.
verses.comment: High priest held to stricter standards than other priests.

verses.text: He shall not leave the sanctuary nor profane the sanctuary of his God, for the consecration of the anointing oil of his God is upon him. I am the LORD.
verses.comment: ‘Anointing oil’ is the mark of his special status.

verses.text: He shall take a wife who is a virgin.
verses.comment: Specific requirement for high priest distinct from ordinary priests.

verses.text: He shall not marry a widow, or a divorced woman, or a woman defiled by prostitution; but he shall take a virgin from his own people as his wife.
verses.comment: Maintains all specifics given in the Hebrew.

verses.text: He shall not profane his offspring among his people, for I am the LORD who makes him holy.
verses.comment: 'Profane his offspring' means to compromise the sanctity of priestly family.

verses.text: The LORD said to Moses,
verses.comment: Introductory formula for additional instruction.

verses.text: "Speak to Aaron, saying: None of your descendants throughout their generations who has a physical defect may come near to offer the bread of his God.
verses.comment: 'Physical defect' translates the Hebrew 'mum,' meaning visible blemish or disability.

verses.text: For no one who has a defect may come near: no man who is blind or lame, or who has a mutilated face or a deformed limb,
verses.comment: Plain language but literal: blind, lame, mutilated, deformed.

verses.text: or a man who has a broken foot or a broken hand,
verses.comment: Maintained specific listing.

verses.text: or who is a hunchback or a dwarf, or who has a defect in his eye or a rash or scabs or damaged testicles.
verses.comment: ‘Dwarf’ translates ‘dak,’ meaning short of stature; includes all listed defects.

verses.text: No descendant of Aaron the priest who has a defect shall come near to offer the LORD's food offerings. Because of his defect, he shall not come near to offer the bread of his God.
verses.comment: Repeat for emphasis; priest may serve but not at altar.

verses.text: He may eat the bread of his God, both of the most holy and of the holy things.
verses.comment: Priests with defects retain some privileges.

verses.text: But he shall not go through the veil or approach the altar, because he has a defect, so that he does not profane My holy places; for I am the LORD who makes them holy."
verses.comment: Restricts access to inner sanctuary and altar.

verses.text: So Moses spoke these words to Aaron and to his sons and to all the people of Israel.
verses.comment: Concludes with Moses delivering God's instruction.
